penAI has introduced GPT-4.5, their latest and most capable model yet in terms of world knowledge.

It brings improvements in accuracy, conversation flow, and multimodal understanding. But letâ€™s get straight to the point â€” this release feels a bit premature, and the API pricing is significantly higher than expected.

So, is this an actual leap forward, or just an expensive refinement?

Whatâ€™s New?

GPT-4.5 builds on past models with several notable upgrades:

âœ”ï¸ Improved factual accuracy â€” It recalls information with greater precision.
âœ”ï¸ Lower hallucination rate â€” Responses are more reliable and grounded.

The Issues: Pricing and Purpose

For all its improvements, GPT-4.5 has some drawbacks, mainly in pricing and positioning.

ğŸ’° The cost is significantly higher than GPT-4o:

At 30 times the price of GPT-4o, this is not a model aimed at general users.

Itâ€™s not a major jump for advanced reasoning tasks. While itâ€™s more factually accurate, it still doesnâ€™t match OpenAIâ€™s dedicated reasoning models for complex problem-solving in areas like math, logic, and advanced coding.

Who is this for? OpenAI seems to be targeting large organizations and developers building specialized AI applications rather than smaller teams or individual users.

Whatâ€™s Next? GPT-4.5 as the Foundation for Future AI

OpenAI has positioned GPT-4.5 as a stepping stone for upcoming advancements. Future models will likely build on its expanded knowledge base, leading to:

âœ”ï¸ Better reasoning models

Is GPT-4.5 Worth It? Final Verdict

GPT-4.5 is a refinement rather than a breakthrough. It enhances world knowledge and accuracy but comes at a very high price. While it may serve as the foundation for future AI models, itâ€™s not a must-have for most users today.
